sentence: Share price of The Procter & Gamble CompanyPG increased 2.1% on Mar 16 as media reports indicated that the branded consumer products company would likely sell or spin off some of its beauty brands.
The company is reportedly in talks with its advisers on the plan and no final decision has been made yet.
Procter & Gamble's Beauty business has remained weak for the past two fiscal years.
Despite growth in the overall market, the company is losing market share due to aggressive competitive activity.
In particular, Pantene and Olay brands, which account for about 25% of Beauty segment sales, have underperformed.
The company expects the segment to benefit from "simplification and strengthening" of category and portfolio.
However, Beauty is not the only business this Zacks Rank #4 (Sell) company plans to streamline.
Procter & Gamble announced plans to trim its portfolio in Aug 2014 to focus on brands that generate most of its revenues.
Later, during the Consumer Analyst Group Conference Call in Feb 2015, Procter & Gamble reaffirmed that it intends to sell about 100 brands.
Sales of most of these brands have been declining in low single digits over the past three years.
Instead, the company intends to focus on the rest of its brands so that it can redirect its resources to fast growing businesses.
The company has already divested, discontinued or plans to consolidate 35 brands.
The company has already exited the bleach business, pet care, Duracell, MDVIP; the Naomi Campbell, Avril Lavigne, and Puma fragrance brands; the DDF and Noxzema skincare brands; and Camay and Zest.
The company intends to close this restructuring program by the end of 2016.
We believe that a smaller and more focused company should be able to grow faster, create more value and be much easier to manage.

Other Stocks to Consider

Better-ranked stocks in the consumer goods sector include The Clorox Co. CLX , Reckitt Benckiser Group plc RBGLY and Unilever plc UL .
All three companies carry a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
